___https-address.description: Leave empty for listening on all interfaces.

___http-address.description: Leave empty for listening on all interfaces.

___config-file.description: Path to additional Traefik config file. Directive will be ignored if file doesn't exist upon service start.

___secret-name.description: Name of the Secret Store credentials to use for DC/OS service authentication. This should be left empty unless service authentication is needed.

___admin-address.description: Leave empty for listening on all interfaces.

___keep-alive.description: Set the TCP Keep Alive interval for the Marathon HTTP Client.

___dialer-timeout.description: Amount of time to allow the Marathon provider to wait to open a TCP connection to a Marathon master.

___domain.description: Default domain. Can be overridden by setting the 'traefik.domain' label on an application.

___force-task-hostname.description: By default, a task's IP address (as returned by the Marathon API) is used as backend server if an IP-per-task configuration can be found; otherwise, the name of the host running the task is used. The latter behavior can be enforced by enabling this switch.

___expose.description: Expose Marathon apps by default in Traefik.

___endpoint.description: Marathon endpoint, multiple instances separate by comma.

___respect-readiness-checks.description: During deployment Traefik will respect readiness checks if defined in Marathon.

___user.description: The user that runs the Traefik service and owns the Mesos sandbox.

___mem.description: Memory (MB) to allocate to each Traefik task.

___role.description: Deploy Traefik only on nodes with this role.

___cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to each Traefik instance.
